intro: Primulina pteropoda, commonly known as the velvet leaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae, native to Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its unique foliage and compact growth make it a popular choice for terrariums and indoor gardens.
